perturbation.original_text:
Within 30 days of the end of each quarter during the term of this agreement, PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT shall receive from THE HENRY FILM
AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, a detailed accounting statement showing Net Due and Paid Shared Revenues for that quarter and shall
remit to PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT its share of such revenues.
perturbation.changed_text: Within 90 days of the end of each fiscal year, THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION shall provide PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT with a single lump-sum payment representing 10% of annual net revenue, without any detailed accounting statement.
perturbation.explanation: The modification changes the payment frequency from quarterly to annually, extends the payment deadline from 30 days post-quarter to 90 days post-fiscal year, and eliminates the requirement for a detailed accounting statement. Under California law, partners in a business venture are entitled to regular and transparent accountings. Delaying payments and eliminating detailed statements violates these requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Corporations Code Section 16403 and general principles of fiduciary duty in partnership law.

perturbation.original_text:
After the Initial Term, this Agreement will be automatically renewed for successive additional 3~year periods (“Extension Terms”), unless
otherwise terminated by either party by giving notice to the other party not less than sixty (60) days prior to the end of a Term.
perturbation.changed_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement will be automatically renewed for successive additional 10-year periods ("Extension Terms"), unless otherwise terminated by either party by giving notice to the other party not less than fifteen (15) days prior to the end of a Term.
perturbation.explanation: This modification increases the renewal period from 3 years to 10 years and decreases the required notice period for termination from 60 days to 15 days. While generally permissible, this could be deemed unconscionable under California law if the shortened notice period is considered unreasonably short and favors one party significantly, especially given the agreement's exclusive nature. This would particularly be an issue if PACIFICAP faces a significant disadvantage from the extended renewal period and limited notice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code Section 1670.5 regarding unconscionable contracts.

perturbation.original_text:
ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE SETTLED VIA BINDING ARBITRATION ACCORDING TO THE RULES
AND REGULATIONS SET FORTH BY THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY , THE STATE OF
CALIFORNIA.
perturbation.changed_text: ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE SETTLED VIA BINDING ARBITRATION WHERE THE ARBITRATOR IS SELECTED SOLELY BY THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION.
perturbation.explanation: By granting THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION the sole right to select the arbitrator, this clause creates a significant conflict of interest and undermines the impartiality of the arbitration process. California law requires that arbitration processes be fair and neutral. This modification raises concerns that the selected arbitrator will be biased towards the selecting party, thus rendering the agreement unconscionable or unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Code of Civil Procedure Sections 1281.6 (neutral arbitrator) and 1286.2 (grounds for vacating arbitration award).
